snippet: Many of the foreigners who do come now are people drawn by the very turmoil that keeps tourists away: aid workers, journalists, refugees.
abstract: Jerash Journal; ancient ruins in Jerash, 160-acre site 20 miles from Syrian border and one of Jordan's main attractions, experiences drop in tourism threatening local economy; residents and business owners blame international community for not ending brutal violence caused by Syria's civil war, and Jordanian government and tourism industry for weakly promoting country.
lead_paragraph: Many of the foreigners who do come now are people drawn by the very turmoil that keeps tourists away: aid workers, journalists, refugees.

headline.print_headline: Chaos on Jordan’s Doorstep Batters Tourism
headline.main: Conflicts in Syria and Region Take Toll on Jordan’s Tourism
